info.title: Model Rest Endpoints
info.description:
**Model Rest Endpoint List:** - Load Models - Convert to Model - Load versions of a Model - Load versions of a Model by Run Id - Fetch Metadata - Get Signature and Input Example - Update Staging Model Compute - Get Staging Model Logs - Stop Staging Model - Start Staging Model - Add Tag - Update Tag - Delete Tag - Update Notes - Promote to Production - Load Production Models - Update Scaling Policy - Stop Production Model - Start Production Model - Get Production Model Logs **Common Response Fields:** | **Fields** | **Description** | | --- | --- | | id | Deployment ID of the entity | | creationDate | Creation Date of the entity | | lastModificationDate | Last Modification Date of the entity | | active | active = `true` means entity is active.
active = `false` means entity is deleted. |

get.description:
This request endpoint returns the list of all models registered in the system and their meta data.

---

**Response Fields:**

| **Fields** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| id | Unique Identifier of a Model (model-id). |
| name | The name of the model deployment. |
| type | The type of the model deployment (Regression, Classification, etc.). |
| description | A brief description of the model deployment. |
| latestProductionVersion | The latest version of the model that has been deployed in production. |
| latestStagingVersion | The latest version of the model that has been deployed in staging. |
| activeProductionVersion | The active version of the model that is currently running in production. |
| activeStagingVersion | The active version of the model that is currently running in staging. |
| latestProdVersionStatus | The status of the latest version of the model running in production (ON/OFF). |
| latestStagingVersionStatus | The status of the latest version of the model running in staging (ON/OFF). |

schema.example: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Authorization

example.name: xgboost-model
example.description: This is a demo model deployment

post.description:
---

This request endpoint packages a model as a self-contained docker image and stages it to a Kubernetes Cluster. After the model turns ON, a REST API endpoint will become available for execution.

---

**Request Payload Fields:**

| **Fields** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| experimentName | The name of the experiment. |
| runId | A unique identifier for the experiment run. |
| deploymentGroupId | A unique identifier for the deployment group. |
| deploymentGroupName | The name of the deployment group (Model Name). |
| deploymentGroupType | The type of the deployment group (Regression, Classification, etc.). |
| deploymentGroupDescription | A brief description of the deployment group. |
| compute | An identifier for the compute resource. |
| modelPath | Storage path of the model artifacts. |

example.deploymentGroupDescription: This is a demo model deployment

schema.example: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Authorization

get.description:
This request endpoint returns the list of all models registered in the system and their meta data.

---

**Query Params:**

| **Fields** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| page | Page Number. |
| perPage | Records per Page. |
| modelName | Text to search Model Name (Case Insensitive). |

**Response Fields:**

| **Fields** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| page | Page Number. |
| perPage | Records per Page. |
| total | Total number of records. |
| totalPages | Number of total pages. |
| id | Unique Identifier of a Model (model-id). |
| name | The name of the model deployment. |
| type | The type of the model deployment (Regression, Classification, etc.). |
| description | A brief description of the model deployment. |
| latestProductionVersion | The latest version of the model that has been deployed in production. |
| latestStagingVersion | The latest version of the model that has been deployed in staging. |
| activeProductionVersion | The active version of the model that is currently running in production. |
| activeStagingVersion | The active version of the model that is currently running in staging. |
| latestProdVersionStatus | The status of the latest version of the model running in production (ON/OFF). |
| latestStagingVersionStatus | The status of the latest version of the model running in staging (ON/OFF). |

schema.example: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Authorization

data.name: xgboost-model
data.description: This is a demo model deployment

get.description:
This request endpoint returns the metadata of all versions of a given model and their staging & production details (REST API Endpoint, model path, etc.).

---

**Path Param:**

`model-id`: Unique Identifier of a Model. Refer [Load Models](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/8413266/2s8ZDVYiNN#899b7aa9-8a61-4843-badb-fd61aebd5fdc) API for the value of this field. Update value of this field in the environment variable to operate this API.

**Response Fields:**

- `modelVersion`: The version of the model that is being deployed.
- `experimentName`: The name of the experiment.
- `runId`: A unique identifier for the experiment run.
- `user`: Information about the user who deployed the model.
- `stagingModel`: Information about the staging model. It contains details such as model's id, active status, url, status (ON/OFF), compute details, deploymentName and last start time of the model.
- `prodModel`: Information about the production model. It contains details such as model's id, active status, url, status (ON/OFF), compute details, deploymentName and last start time of the model.

schema.example: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Authorization

get.summary: Load versions of a Model by Run ID
get.description:
This request endpoint returns the details of a model for a given experiment run. It helps in avoiding duplicate registration of a model from a same experiment run. If no model was registered from the given run, response will be empty.

---

**Response Fields:**

- `modelVersion`: The version of the model that is being deployed.
- `experimentName`: The name of the experiment.
- `runId`: A unique identifier for the experiment run.
- `user`: Information about the user who is deploying the model.
- `stagingModel`: Information about the staging model.
- `deploymentGroupId`: A unique identifier for the deployment group.
- `deploymentGroupName`: The name of the deployment group (Model Name).

schema.example: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Authorization

get.description:
Returns the notes, parameters, metrics, tags, artifacts path and files for a given model version id

---

This endpoint returns the metadata of a model deployment by its id.

- `notes`: Additional notes about the model deployment.
- `metrics`: An array of key-value pairs representing the metrics of the model deployment.
- `parameters`: An array of key-value pairs representing the parameters of the model deployment.
- `tags`: An array of key-value pairs representing the tags of the model deployment.

schema.example: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Authorization

get.description:
Returns the model signature and input example for given mode version id. If model signature and input example were not logged during experiment run creation, it will return empty response

---

This API returns the input example and signature of a deployed model. It takes in a query parameter `modelVersionId` which is the unique identifier of the model version and `prod` which is a boolean value indicating whether the model is in production or not. The input example is a json object with the column names and data of the input. The signature is a json object that describes the inputs and outputs of the model, including the name, type, and shape of the inputs and outputs. This information can be used to integrate the deployed model with other applications.

schema.example: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Authorization

post.description:
Adds new tag in key:value pair for a model version

---

This API allows you to add a new tag to a specific model deployment. The tag is added to the model deployment identified by the `deploymentVersionId` path parameter.

Body Parameters:

- key: string, Required. The key of the tag.
- value: string, Required. The value of the tag.
    

Response:

- key: string, The key of the added tag.
- value: string, The value of the added tag.

schema.example: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Authorization

put.description:
Update key,value tag for a model version

---

Description: This API allows you to update the tag of a specific deployment version.

Body:

- key: (string) key of the tag
- value: (string) value of the tag
    

Response:

- key: (string) key of the tag
- value: (string) value of the tag

schema.example: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Authorization

delete.description:
Delete key,value tag for a model version

---

Body Parameters:

- key (string): The key of the tag to be deleted
- value (string): The value of the tag to be deleted
    

Response:

- No response body is returned for this request

put.description: Update notes for a model version

example.note: XGBoost, which stands for Extreme Gradient Boosting, is a scalable, distributed gradient-boosted decision tree (GBDT) machine learning library. It provides parallel tree boosting and is the leading machine learning library for regression, classification, and ranking problems.

example.note: XGBoost, which stands for Extreme Gradient Boosting, is a scalable, distributed gradient-boosted decision tree (GBDT) machine learning library. It provides parallel tree boosting and is the leading machine learning library for regression, classification, and ranking problems.

post.description:
Promote a model to production

#### Request Payload

- `minPod` (int): Minimum number of pods to be used for the model
- `maxPod` (int): Maximum number of pods to be used for the model
- `cpuUtilization` (int): CPU utilization percentage for the model
- `memoryUtilization` (int): Memory utilization percentage for the model
- `computeId` (string): ID of the compute resource to be used for the model
    

#### Response Payload

- `actionType` (string): Type of action performed
- `entityType` (string): Type of entity affected
- `entityId` (string): ID of the affected entity
- `message` (string): Description of the action performed
- `actionStatus` (string): Status of the action performed

schema.example: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Authorization

get.description:
This request endpoint provides information about all the Production Models in the system. API access is restricted to users with Admin access to the system.

---

**Response Fields:**

- `id`: Production Model ID.
- `versionId`: Model Version ID.
- `modelName`: The name of the model deployment.
- `version`: Model Version Name.
- `modelPath`: Storage path of the model artifacts.
- `url`: Production Model Endpoint.
- `status`: Production Model status - `ON`, `OFF`, `STARTING`, `STOPPING` or `FAILED`.
- `deploymentName`: Name of the deployment in Kubernetes Cluster.
- `minPod`: Minimum number of application instances.
- `maxPod`: Maximum number of application instances.
- `cpuUtilization`: Target CPU Utilization % value. Average CPU Utilization above this value will trigger application scaling.
- `memoryUtilization`: Target Memory Utilization % value. Average Memory Utilization above this value will trigger application scaling.
- `threadsPerWorker`: Number of threads to help parallel processing within a Gunicorn Worker.
- `workersCount`: Number of Gunicorn Workers.
- `tags`: Label - Key:Value Pair.

schema.example: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Authorization

put.description:
Update scaling policy for a production model.

---

The request body contains the following fields:

- id: The id of the scaling policy.
- minPod: The minimum number of pods to be maintained.
- maxPod: The maximum number of pods to be maintained.
- cpuUtilization: The target CPU utilization percentage.
- memoryUtilization: The target memory utilization percentage.
- compute: An object containing the id of the compute resource.
- workersCount: Number of worker to be used.
- threadsPerWorker: Number of threads per worker
    

The response contains a JSON object with the updated scaling policy.  
It includes fields like status, deploymentName, lastStartTime, minPod, maxPod, cpuUtilization, memoryUtilization, transformationEnabled, compute, computeId, threadsPerWorker, workersCount.
